sim.author: Gerhard Kick, Joshua Davidson (it0uchpods) and many others

help.title: FG-Platypus Navigator
help.line: Start Routine
1. fuel on most full tank ("j" toggles selector on left side)
2. all toggles OFF
3. battery master switch to ON ("!" toggles battery master switch)
4. alternator master switch to ON ("@" toggles battery master switch)
5. electric fuel pump ON ("#" toggles fuel pump switch)
6. magnetos to both("}" three times)
7. set mixture to full ("m" advance lever)
8. set throttle to 20%
9. primer pump three times,("P") then lock
10. "CLEAR PROP"
11. key to start ("s" engages starter)
12. pitot heat ON if IFR ("*" toggles pitot heat switch)
13. lights as required
14. turn on avionics master ("%"
All switches and controls can be operated via "hot-spots"
Type Ctrl-C to display mouse "hot-spots"
Press Shift K to view hot-keys
Checklists can be displayed from the Warrior Menu
Instructions on how to start in the air are found under the practise
approaches option of the Warrior menu.
Navigational Info is contained under HowTo
Trouble - Check out General Settings Doco
For additional resources checkout the FG Forum

sim.spec:
Vne (never exceed).....160 KIAS Vno (max. cruise)..........126 KIAS Vfe (max. flaps).............103 KIAS Va (maneuvering).........111 KIAS (2440 lb)-88 KIAS (1531 lb) Vs (clean stall)................50 KIAS Vso (flaps stall)...............44 KIAS Vglide (best glide)..........73 KIAS Vx (best climb angle).....63 KIAS Vy (best climb rate)........79 KIAS Enroute climb....................87 KIAS Approach (no flaps)........70 KIAS Approach (full flaps).......63 KIAS
Cruise (75%, 8000 ft): 124 KTAS (107 KIAS) Cruise (55%, 8000 ft): 103 KTAS (89 KIAS)
Take off.............................full Throttle Climb..................................full Throttle 75% power at 8,000 ft......2665 rpm 75% power at 4,000 ft......2570 rpm 75% power at sea level....2480 rpm 55% power at 12,000 ft....2470 rpm 55% power at 8,000 ft......2375 rpm 55% power at 4,000 ft......2285 rpm 55% power at sea level....2195 rpm
sim.kbindings:
Config Lights Dialogs Autopilot ---------------------- ------------------- ------------------- ------------------------
! - Toggle Battery Switch Ctrl-p Cycle Panel Light ? - Display Help F9 - Open ITAF
@ - Toggle Alternator Switch Ctrl-l Cycle Cabin Light F5 - Performance Data F11 - Toggle AP on//off
# - Toggle Fuel Pump $ - Toggle Landing Light k - Display Map Ctrl-a Lock Altitude
P - Toggle Primer Pump tba - Toggle Nav Lights r - Show Route Manager Ctrl-h Toggle Roll/Hdg mode
s - Activate Starter S - Toggle Strobe Lights w - Show AC Config Ctrl-n Set Nav mode
* - Toggle Pitot Heat Ctrl-b Toggle Beacon Light Ctrl-s Show Flight Stats Ctrl-g Arm Glide Slope
% - Toggle Avionics Switch Ctrl - d Daylight Setting D - Show Dash Bar Ctrl-w Invoke Roll Mode
u - Toggle Carburetor Heat n - Midnight Setting K - Show Shortcut Keys Shift-n Toggle Nav/GPS Modes
g - Reset Radar Altimeter l - cycle Flashlight R - Set Rego/Callsign
d - Open/Close Door
C - Show Presets Config
sim.bank:
Standard Rate of turn = 3 degrees per second regardless of speed - the variable being the bank angle. A 180 degree turn will take 1 minute, a full 360 degree circle will take 2 minutes.
To determine the bank angle either:
Divide the airspeed by 10 and add 7 e.g. Airspeed = 120 knots / 10 + 7 = Bank angle of 19 degrees or Rule of thumb simply divide TAS by 15 e.g.Airspeed=120 knots / 15 = Bank angle of 18 degrees
Standard Rate of Turn Calcs:
Rule of thumb for small heading change: The bank angle should be less or equal to the number of heading degree change required.
ROT =( Constant (1091) x tangent of bank angle)/airspeed The tangent of 18 degrees = 0.3249 ...Calculator handy ? e.g. 1091 x 0.3249/120 = 2.95 degrees per second
Radius of Turn Calcs R = Airspeed squared /( 11.26 x Tangent of Bank Angle) e.g. 120knots squared = 14400, Tangent of 20 degrees = 0.3639 _14400 / (11.26 x 0.3639) = 3514 feet
Assume the bank angle were 30 degrees the calc would return Tangent of 30 degrees = 0.5773 _14400 / (11.26 x 0.5773) = 2115 feet
Assume bank angle at 30 degrees and airspeed 90 knots Airspeed squared = 8100 _8100 / (11.26 x 0.5773) = 1246 feet
The higher the speed the greater the radius For more info consult the FAA handbooks. Note: Steepening the turn results in a higher stall speed ! ...
sim.procs: -> -> RACETRACK PATTERN -> Fly 2 minutes straight and level and reduce speed to holding speed Turn 180 degrees to the right, rollout on the reciprocal of the original heading Time a 1 minute straight and level flight, then perform another 180 degree turn to the right and roll out on the original heading. Fly 1 minute on the original heading so that the inbound leg will be 1 minute as well. -> -> 45 DEGREE PROCEDURE TURN -> Fly outbound for 3 minutes Turn left by 45 degrees, time the leg for 40 seconds Turn 225 degrees to the right (standard turn rate) Align with the reciprocal of the original heading -> -> TEARDROP -> Stabilize outbound Option A Turn left 30 degrees and time 1 minute Turn right 210 degrees and align with the final heading Option B Turn left 20 degrees and time 2 minutes Turn right 200 degrees and align with the final heading Option A Turn left 10 degrees and time 3 minutes Turn right 190 degrees and align with the final heading -> -> CIRCLING APPROACH -> 2 minutes out from the runway reduce speed to approach speed Make a 45 degree standard turn to the left, once rolled out time 45 seconds Immediately turn to the orignal heading,flying parallel to the runway and fly this leg for 1 minute lowering flaps Turn right a 180 degrees rolling out on the reciprocal of the orignal heading Enter a 500 fpm descent and once the decent is complete - enter a straight constant speed climb retracting flaps > Note: All procedures require wind correction! -> 80/260 PROCEDURE TURN -> -> Identify the approach procedure fix Fly from the procedure fix 2 minutes Turn left 80 degrees At completion of the turn immediately turn left 260 degrees Roll out on the reciprocal of the entry heading -> -> ->
sim.preflight:
Preflight
Control Wheel - release belts Avionics Master - OFF Parking Brake - set Electric Switches - OFF (except beacon) Magneto Switch - OFF Mixture - idle cut off Master Switch - ON Fuel Quantity Gauges - check Master Switch - OFF Flight Controls - free and correct Flaps - check Trim - check, set Pitot Drain - drain, close Static Drain - drain, close Windows - check, clean Tow bar - stow Baggage - stowed and secure Master Switch - ON Cockit Lighting - check Nav, Landing and Strobe Lights - check Stall warning - check Pitot Heat - check All Switches - OFF (except beacon) Passengers - board Cabin Door - close and secure Belts/Harnesses - fasten - check reel
sim.bes:
Before Starting Engine
Weight and Balance - check
Parking Brake - set
Carburetor Heat - OFF
Fuel Selector - desired tank
Avionics Master - OFF
Circuit Breakers - check
sim.ces:
Cold Engine Start
Throttle - 1/4 inch open
Master Battery Switch - ON
Alternator Switch - On
Electric Fuel Pump - test then OFF
Mixture - full rich
Magnetos - set to both
Primer - x 3 and lock
Starter - engage
Throttle - adjust for 1100 RPM
Oil Pressure - check, green
If engine does not start within 10 seconds, prime and repeat
sim.hes:
Hot Engine Start
Throttle - 1/2 inch open
Master Battery Switch - ON
Alternator Switch - ON
Electric Fuel Pump - test then OFF
Mixture - full rich
Magnetos - set to both
Primer - x 3 and lock
Starter - engage
Throttle - adjust for 1100 RPM
Oil Pressure - check, green
sim.fes:
Flooded Engine Start
Throttle - open full
Master Battery Switch - ON
Alternator Switch - ON
Electric Fuel Pump - test then OFF
Mixture - idle cut off
Magnetos - set to both
Primer - x 3 and lock
Starter - engage
Mixture - advance
Throttle - adjust for 1100 RPM
Oil Pressure - check, green
sim.wup:
Warm Up
Mixture - lean for taxi
Throttle - adjust for 1100 RPM
Exterior Lights - as required
Avionics Master - ON
Check ATIS
Set Altimeter
Set Heading Bug to Runway Heading
Transponder - ALT and check code
sim.tax:
Taxi
Chocks - removed
Taxi Area - clear
Brakes - check
Throttle - applied slowly
Steering - check
sim.grc:
Ground Check
Parking Brake - set Mixture - rich Fuel Selector - switch tanks ? Throttle - adjust for 2000 RPM Magnetos - check L and R Max drop 175 RPM, Max difference 50 RPM Vacuum - 5.0 Hg +/- 0.1 Hg Oil Temp - check, green Oil Pressure - check, green Ammeter - verify output Carburetor Heat - ON Electric Fuel Pump - OFF Fuel Pressure - check, green Carburetor Heat - OFF Throttle - adjust for 1100 RPM
sim.bto:
Before Takeoff
Master Battery Switch - ON Alternator Switch - ON Seat Backs - erect Controls - free and correct Flight Instruments - set, check Fuel Selector - desired tank Electric Fuel Pump - ON Engine Gauges - check, green External Lights - as required Carburetor Heat - OFF Mixture - rich Primer - Locked Belts and Harnesses - fastened/adjusted Empty Seats - loose articles secured Flaps - set Trim - set Radios and Transponder - set Doors and Windows - latched
sim.nto:
Normal Takeoff
Flaps - set as required
Trim - set
Brake - release
Throttle - advance to full
Accelerate to 45 to 55 (K)IAS
Control Wheel - back pressure as required
sim.shfo:
Short Field, Obstacle Clearance
Flaps - second notch
Trim - set
Brake - release
Throttle - advance to full (alternatively revv up before brake release)
Accelerate to 52 (K)IAS
Control Wheel - back pressure as required
Maintain 52 KIAS until obstacle clearance
Retract flaps SLOWLY, then accilerate to 79 KIAS
sim.shfn:
Short Field, No Obstacle
Flaps - 0 (retracted)
Trim - set
Brake - release
Throttle - full
Accelerate to 50 KIAS
Control Wheel - back pressure as required
After lift off, accelerate to 79 KIAS
sim.sofo:
Soft Field, Obstacle Clearance
Flaps - (second notch)
Trim - set
Brake - release
Throttle - full
Accelerate and lift off nose gear as soon as possible
Lift off a lowest possible airspeed
Accelerate just above ground to 52 KIAS to climb past obstacle, then climb at Vy pitch.
Retract flaps SLOWLY, then acceleate to 79 KIAS
sim.sofn:
Soft Field, No Obstacle
Flaps - (second notch)
Trim - set
Brake - release
Throttle - full
Accelerate and lift off nose gear as soon as possible
Lift off a lowest possible airspeed
Accelerate just above ground to 52 KIAS, then climb at Vy pitch
Retract flaps SLOWLY, then accelerate to 79 KIAS
sim.clb:
Climb
Flaps - 0 (retracted)
Landing Light - OFF
Best Climb Rate (flaps 0) - 79 KIAS
Best Climb Angle (flaps 0) - 63 KIAS
Engine Parameters - check
Enroute Climb - 87 KIAS
Electric Fuel Pump - OFF at desired altitude
External Lights - as desired
sim.crs:
Cruise
Reference performance charts and Acvo-Lycoming Operator's Manual
Normal Max Power - 75%
Power - set per power table
Mixture - adjust
sim.des:
Descent
Throttle - 2500 RPM
Airspeed - 126 KIAS max
Mixture - rich
Carburetor Heat - ON if required
Altimeter - set QNH
Radios set - check
sim.apl:
Approach and Landing
Winds - check
Fuel Selector - desired tank
Seat Backs - erect
Belts and Harnesses - fasten/adjust
Electric Fuel Pump - ON
Mixture - set
External Lights - as desired
Flaps - set - 103 KIAS max
Trim to 70 KIAS
Final Approach Speed (flaps 40) - 63 KIAS
sim.ste:
Stopping Engine
Flaps - (0) retract
Throttle - adjust for 1800 RPM
Electric Fuel Pump - OFF
External Lights and Electrical Equipment - OFF (except beacon)
Transponder - OFF
Avionics Master - OFF
Throttle - adjust for 1100 RPM
Mixture - idle cut off
Magnetos - OFF (when prop stops)
Master Battery Switch - OFF
Alternator Switch - OFF
sim.pkg:
Parking
Control Wheel - secure with belts
Flaps - 0 (retracted)
Wheel Chocks - in place
Tie Downs - secure
sim.efs:
Engine Fire During Start
Attempt to extinguish the fire by:
Mixture - idle cut off
Throttle - open
Electric Fuel Pump - OFF
Fuel Selector - OFF
Abandon airplane if fire continues
sim.fif:
Fire In Flight
Source of Fire - check
Electrical Fire (smoke in cabin):
Master Battery Switch - OFF
Alternator Switch - OFF
Vents - open
Cabin Heat - OFF
Land as soon as practical
Engine Fire:
Fuel Selector - OFF
Throttle - closed
Mixture - idle cut off
Electric Fuel Pump - OFF
Heating - OFF
Defroster - OFF
Proceed with power off landing procedure
sim.plt:
Engine Power Loss During Takeoff
If sufficient runway remains for a normal landing, land straight ahead
If insufficient runway remains: Maintain safe airspeed, make only shallow turns to avoid obstructions
Flaps as situation requires, if sufficient altitude gained to attempt restart: Maintain safe airspeed
Fuel Selector - switch to tank containing fuel
Electric Fuel Pump - ON
Mixture - rich
Carburetor Heat - ON
Primer - locked
If power is not regained, proceed with power off landing
sim.plf:
Engine Power Loss In Flight
Fuel Selector - switch to tank containing fuel
Electric Fuel Pump - ON
Mixture - rich - Carburetor - ON
Engine Gauges - for indication of cause of power loss
Primer - locked
If no fuel pressure is indicated, check tank selector position to be sure it is on a tank containing fuel
When power is restored:
Carburetor Heat - OFF
Electric Fuel Pump - OFF
If power is not restored, prepare for power off landing, trim for 73 KIAS
sim.pol:
Power Off Landing
Locate suitable field, establish spiral pattern
1000ft above field at downwind, position for normal landing approach
When field can easily be reached, slow to 63 KIAS for shortest landing
Touchdowns should normally be made at lowest possible airspeed with full flaps
When committed to landing:
Ignition - OFF
Master Battery Switch - OFF
Alternator Switch - OFF
Fuel Selector - OFF
Mixture - idle cut off
Belts and Harnesses - tight
BEST GLIDE SPEED: 73 KIAS
sim.elf:
Electrical Failures
Note: When operating with light electrical load and a fully charged battery,
Alternator Inop light may illuminate due to minimal alternator output.
If the alternator is functional, a slight increase in electrical load should extinguish the Inop indication.
ALT annunciator light illuminated:
Ammeter - check to verify inop, alternator
If ammeter shows zero:
ALT Switch - OFF
Reduce electrical loads to minimum
ALT Circuit Breaker - check and reset as required
If power not restored:
ALT Switch - OFF
If alternator output cannot be restored, reduce electrical loads and land as soon as practical
The battery is the only remaining source of electrical power.
sim.elo:
Electrical Overload
(Alternator over 20 amps above known electrical load)
Electrical Load - reduce
If alternator loads are not reduced:
ALT Switch - OFF
Land as soon as practical. Battery is the only remaining source of power
Anticipate complete electrical failure
sim.lop:
Loss of Oil Pressure
Land as soon as possible and investigate cause
Prepare for power off landing
sim.hot:
High Oil Temperature
Land at nearest airport and investigate the problem
Prepare for power off landing
sim.lfp:
Loss Of Fuel Pressure
Electric Fuel Pump - ON
Fuel Selector - check on fullest tank
Prepare for engine failure
sim.enr:
Engine Roughness
Carburetor Heat - ON
If roughness continues after one (1) minute:
Carburetor Heat - OFF
Mixture - adjust for maximum smoothness
Electric Fuel Pump - >ON
Fuel Selector - switch tanks
Engine Gauges - check
Magneto Switch - L then R then both
If operation is satisfactory on either one,continue on that magneto at reduced power and full rich mixture at first airport
sim.cic:
Carburetor Icing
Carburetor Heat - ON
Mixture - adjust for maximum smoothness
Descend to lower altitude
sim.spr:
Spin Recovery
Throttle - idle
Ailerons - neutral
Rudder - full opposite to direct of rotation
Control Wheel - full forward
Rudder - neutral (when rotation stops)
Control Wheel - as required to smoothly regain level flight attitude
sim.tpr:
Takeoff Practise
You set the scene by nominating your airport and desired runway. You can select a short or long runway, with or without obstacle clearance or perhaps a soft field for different types of take offs. Check out the relevant checklist. To start the engine just press s and release the brakes when in takeoff config.
You can use the wind simulator to set a headwind, tail or crosswind. After a few secs airborne the sim will pause and display your takeoff stats with the option to continue flying or to reset the craft to the runway with the engine running to repeat the takeoff as often as you wish.
You can also test take off performance using airports at sea or high altitude to see the impact of air density and also can experiment with different load and CG configurations. Please bear in mind that some of the functionality is still experimental and work in progress,
sim.tar:
Taxi 2 Taxi
Ground Navigation at times may require a little practise for one to keep the aircraft on the yellow centreline and also to finding your way on an unfamiliar airport.
Here s a challenge for the expert starting off cold n dark ... Nice big airport, taxi ways marked and wide runways at EGKK starting at park position VIP2. Set the heading bug to runway hdg 257, start the engine and turn to heading 50 turn right onto taxiway Y, contine on Y and turn left twice, turn left after the red white blastwall, line up with the runway between the tower on the right and the Vasi on the left. Once on the runway full throttle, take off and maintain heading of 257. After a couple of minutes turn around and descend to runway 8L and taxi back to the original park position. If all over the place like a drunk, press 5 to straighten up from time to time. -------------------------------------- For additional practise you can use the StartAtParkPos quickstart command file in the QuickStarts folder
sim.sap:
Select Approach
Nominate your airport of choice, runway, altitude and distance from the airport and click on run. The aircraft will be positioned at your nominated location in a frozen state to allow you to set relevant nav frequencies, adf etc. Once you press p to unpause, the engine will be running and the autopilot set to heading mode. Now you can fly an ILS approach, practise going down the glide slope using VASI or PAPi or turn the autopilot off and go down VFR style. Navigation options are 2 CDIs, or the HSI, NDB, Compass or the autopilot in Nav and subsequent Approach mode.
For detailed info and other command line scenarios refer to the Approach documentation
sim.pat:
Patterns
This is a hardcoded scenario placing you above and short of London EGKK to perform standard patterns and procedures like teardrop, racetrack, 45 degree turn, 80/260 procedure turn etc.
Check out the procedures primer from the menu.
Naturally one can replicate this scenario at any other airport depending on available radio facilities. For this scenario the localizer frequency/radial and the frequency/radial of the reciprocal are preset
Click the Run button to continue...
sim.mapp: Way below the MAP but coming in too high, yet the instructions are to initiate a missed approach which deviates slightly from the approach chart. The localiser frequency is preset to VOR TNT R018, note the station is roughly two miles in front of the runway. Once you unpause and the aircraft gets settled, level off, apply full throttle and retract the flaps. (or just click the Hobbs!) Climb out on VOR TNT R008 at 500fpm target 6500 ft (Hold) At 6nm DME outbound turn left and intercept radial 198 to return to the station. Cross the VOR and at DME 7nm outbound initiate a procedure turn to the right heading 240 and fly the leg for 40 seconds then turn left to heading 060 and intercept radial 018, then maintain heading 20 Once at DME 7nm inbound descend at 650 fpm, throttle at 0.55 Once over the last hill flaps out notches based on speed, throttle gradually to idle Press the Run button to proceed...
sim.rnav:
Toncontin (MHTG) airport located in Honduras offers some challenging approaches, RNAV RNP inclusive. In order to simulate RNAV in Flightgear, there are some prerequisites as outlined in the details document. Click the Details button below to view.
IMPORTANT ! Please adhere strictly to the sequence of steps once frozen aloft: 1. Load the route (RNAV_MHTG_02 located in the aircrafts Resource folder) - 2. unpause, - 3. then Activate the route and close the dialog, 4. change the NavSource to GPS (blue button)and 5. place the autopilot in Nav Mode Enjoy !
sim.nfl:
Night-IFR
Well, there are little or no visual reference points at all. As such sole reliance on instruments.
The aircraft will be positioned on the runway and airport of your choice with the flashlight illuminating parts of the panel. Press Shift ! to turn on the battery followed by Ctrl L to turn on the panel lights.Proceeed with the cold and dark routine or choose a panel state from the IT Config menu.
You might wish to try a short island hop in the Caribic or an inter airport shuttle aka Paris Orly to Charles De Gaulle...
Switch to daylight by pressing Ctrl d
sim.cdi:
CDI and GS Failure
Enroute to PHNL Honolulu runway 8L, about 10nm away from the fix lining you up with the runway, a simultaneous malfunction of both Nav1 and Nav2 occurs.
You can resort to either GPS or NDB or a combination of both as there are plenty of fixes and NDBs in close vicinity. You might want to loose some altitude.....
You can either go VFR or if a chart is handy perhaps an NDB approach !
Press Run to get started
sim.efl:
Engine Failure
The aircraft is sitting cold and dark at runway 13L at Moorabbin YMMB Prepare a flightplan including YMMB SID and YMML STAR to transfer the aircraft to Melbourne International YMML, runway 16 and parkposition tba by ground control. Prescribed cruise altitude is 4500ft, set your relevant parameters and takeoff.
Enroute for some reason your engine will fail, check out nearest airports, do the numbers and decide on a course of action to bring the aircraft down safely. Point Cook might be a possible alternative airport given the altitude ? Consult the Power Off Landing Checklist(section PWR) - best glidespeed 73 KIAS
Click the Run button to proceed, good luck !
sim.flp:
Flaps Failure
This short trip starts off at EDNY (Friedrichshafen)runway 24. The city was the home of both the Zeppelin as well as Dornier until the end of WWI. Due to postwar restrictions production was shifted across Lake Constanz to Altenrhein LSZR in Switzerland.
Add the passengers weight each 150lbs and fill the tanks. Start the engine for warm up, set the altimeter to 1362 ft und use the routemanager to define the route from EDNY 24 to LSZR 28R, default approach, NO SID, activate and close.
If AC Config is disabled, press w to display, turn on the HUD if not on and place a check into GPS slaves Nav and close.
Press Shift I until only the GPS Leg info appears top left. The bearing is your heading and the CDI of VOR1 shows the way.
Start, takeoff, place the autopilot in HDG mode, climb to 3500ft and hold following the changing bearing adjusting for winds. Use the DG and VOR1 or the HSI to stay on course...(You can also use the map as a visual aid.
Between the approach 5 and 4 waypoints you are in Austrian airspace and a few minutes later in Switzerland.
Start your decent at wp 28R12, runway elevation LSZR 1306ft, pretty much the same as departure, soft and short runway 1974ft and to make your day the flaps do not move. Good luck! nb. If you climb higher then 3500ft you might get an engine fail as well, in which case you may need to divert to an alternate airport.
sim.wnds:
Switching to Basic Weather Mode for this flight.
This will allow programmed wind scenarios and or give you the choice to nominate your own wind settings to experiment with various head, tail and crosswind scenarios.
You will have stable wind conditions up to 10000ft as the standard layer interpolation will kick in at that level. To retain the default wind config just click the Cancel button.
To return to normal basic or detailed or live weather settings, choose Weather from the Environment menu or simply restart.
You can invoke this mode anytime from the Menu or by pressing W
sim.whsi:
Stay the course
Starting 40nm out of eham rwy 36r at about 3000ft airspeed 100kt altimeter is set to eham elevation 30.36
VOR1 is set to EHAM VOR/DME SPL 108.4 02, standby set to localiser frequency of rwy 36r 111.95 02
VOR2 is set to 111.95 02 as well, ADF is tuned to station NV 332
Panel is set to HSI config, if not familar with the HSI, you may want to check out the HSI Primer section in the Fundamentals.pdf (page 48)
Once you click the run button W A I T for the splash to clear then you need to allow manual weather config, just click OK to close the dialog.
Press p to unpause and fly this without the autopilot or in heading mode
Apply wind correction angles as needed using the HSI.
sim.dev:
Deviation to alternate airport and losing altitude by way of circling.
At times circling may be an reasonable option to shed some altitude within a limited radius.
In this scenario the aircraft will be ready for you on runway 31 of LFMQ.
Your destination is LFMC 09. Prepare you flightplan, take off, climb to 6000ft and hold. Speed at your discretion.
Await further instructions from ATC.
Click Run to proceed when ready...
sim.cirtxt:
ATC advises LFMC is closed due to fog and ILS outage, please divert to LFMN runway 04R passing over Saint Tropez (STP) VOR/DME 116.5 108 LFMN Locator 110.7 44 NDB NC 338
On passage of the STP VOR switch to the Localizer frequency and intercept bearing 44 of the localiser
At DME 12nm out perform a 360 degree standard right hand turn at a vertical speed of -500fpm and on roll out on 46 immediately perform another 360 degree left turn and proceed to LFMN on bearing 45 holding your altitude once rolling out. Approach straight in visual going down manually or use the autopilot. After landing review your flight history in the map
Press p to continue...
sim.alp:
The aircraft has been stripped of unnessary weight to optimise climb performance.
Plan a direct flight taking you from Innsbruck (LOWI) runway 08 to BOZEN (LIPB) runway 01. As you need to cross the alps you will find the valley to narrow to buildup sufficient altitude. One option is to fly out to the Absam NDB turning back to the Innsbruck NDB prior to turning to the heading taking you straight to your destination. (Bearing from GPS) As altitude increases reduce pitch to maintain stable airspeed and adjust mixture accordingly.(or use auto mix in IT-Config) If you have not enough altitude near the rocks turn back to LOWI runway 26 and try again with a full load. (Restore weights after the flight in the Mass Balance Dialog)
Click Run to proceed
